1.text: Choose beets that are roughly the same size to ensure that they cook evenly.

2.text: Cut the leafy stalks off of the top of your beets.

3.text: Slice off the roots protruding from the bottom of the beets.

4.text: Scrub your beets with a vegetable brush to remove excess dirt and debris.

5.text: Rinse your beets thoroughly with cool, clean water.

6.text: Place your beets at the bottom of a pot or saucepan.

7.text: Fill the pot with enough water to completely cover the beets.

8.text: Add 2 tablespoons (30 mL) of vinegar or lemon juice to prevent bleeding.

9.text: Bring the water in your pot to a boil.

10.text: Reduce the heat and simmer the beets for 30-45 minutes.

11.text: Use a knife to check whether your beets are done.

12.text: Fill a large bowl with ice water.

13.text: Transfer the beets to the ice bath using a slotted spoon or pair of tongs.

14.text: Let the beets cool in the ice bath for 2-3 minutes.

15.text: Peel the loose skin off of your beets by hand.
